review: I bought a fire TV stick for my husband at Christmas. Figured it would be nice for him to use on the upstairs TV as he always wants to watch something and it gave him a few more options. It sounded easy enough to install so when he said that it didn't work I thought maybe it was due to our internet being so great upstairs.Last week I finally got around to setting it up myself on our downstairs TV. It was easy enough to do I had a very good signal strength but it also showed 'Connected with problems'. No idea what that meant but I opted to carry on regardless. Anyhow sadly it was not to be. I would start to load a video and the next thing it would read 'Player Error - An internet connection is required...' or "Network Connection Lost' and the most annoying one 'Slow Internet Connection'. I finally gave up but have since tried a few more times. Today being the latest. Not sure at this point if it's the Fire TV stick or if my internet is not what it might be. Maybe a combination of both. If I ever get it up and running I will add an update to my experiences. I'm still hoping for great things.
author: M. Kerr

review: The device works ok, however the primary reason I purchased it was because it supported Miracast. Unfortunately it only works from Kindle and android devices, you cannot use the fire stick from other devices which support miracast.So it's now another item on the "big pile of hardware that didn't live up to its promises".Fortunately it was cheap.
